intro: Minuartia globulosa, commonly known as the globular stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid regions. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. Minuartia globulosa is often found in crevices and on rock surfaces, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
